result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarod Luke Petersen

records.addlTxt: 9:39 AM Cases called; 22CF498 and 22CF442. Defendant Jarod Luke Petersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Jarod Luke Petersen.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 22CF498. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 22CF442 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 36 months. Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. 30 days jail with Huber, imposed and stayed to be used as need by treatment court. Complete Columbia County Drug Treatment Court. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs from either case. 10:01 AM
Filed by Atty Crooks- Mishacoff to Atty Middleton Re: Additional discovery
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Crooks- Mishacoff

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jarod Luke Petersen appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail w/Atty Claire Edwards. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $250.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia, waives time limits to prelim,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
